title: Authors and Citation
text: Kenny C (2024). crayons: Color Palettes Crayon Boxes. R package version 0.0.2.9000,  http://christophertkenny.com/crayons/, https://github.com/christopherkenny/crayons.
code: @Manual{,   title = {crayons: Color Palettes from Crayon Boxes},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.2.9000,  http://christophertkenny.com/crayons/},   url = {https://github.com/christopherkenny/crayons}, }

title: Color Palettes from Crayon Boxes
text: crayons provides crayon-based color palettes. nostalgic uses, consider combining ggrough roughsf. palettes necessarily (unlikely ) color-blind friendly. public-facing work, consider color-blind friendly package, Cory McCartan’s wacolors.

title: Color Palettes from Crayon Boxes
text: crayons available CRAN can installed using: can also install development version crayons GitHub :

title: Color Palettes from Crayon Boxes
text: crayons provides basic ggplot2 scales fill color (also aliased colour).  crayons many palettes, based current long-gone crayon packs.
code: library(ggplot2) library(crayons)  mpg |>   ggplot() +    geom_point(aes(displ, hwy, colour = class)) +    scale_color_crayons(palette = 'original')

title: Crayons Color Palettes — crayons
text: Crayon colors, based common Crayola colors. Palettes build Wikipedia

title: Crayons Color Palettes — crayons
text: Included palettes: billionth, celebrates 100 billionth crayon color_n_smell, scented colors colors_of_the_world, additional human colors construction_paper, colors construction paper fluorescent, neon colors gel_fx, gel colors gem_tones, gemstones heads_n_tails, double sided colors magic_scent, scented colors metallic_fx, metal colors mini_twistables, colors, twistable modern, historical colors since 1990 munsell, historical colors 1926-1944 multicultural, skin colors no_48, historical crayons 48-pack 1949 no_64, historical crayons 64-pack 1958 original, historical crayons original 1903 pearl, updated perlescent colors pearl_brite, pearlescent colors silly_scents, scented reality R silver_swirls, colors tinge silver standard, large set standard colors standard16, colors 16 pack crayons standard24, colors 24 pack crayons standard32, colors 32 pack crayons standard64, colors 64 pack crayons star_brite, colors 1997

title: Crayons Color Palettes — crayons

what: Heuristics for Color Distances and Locations — pick_colors
title: Heuristics for Color Distances and Locations — pick_colors
text: pick_colors() places color RGB space, clusters k-means, returns colors nearest cluster center. color_order() reorders colors subsequent colors far RGB space. color_distance() calculates pairwise distances RGB space colors.

title: Heuristics for Color Distances and Locations — pick_colors
Heuristics for Color Distances and Locations — pick_colors
text: hex character vector hexadecimal colors n integer number desired colors

title: Heuristics for Color Distances and Locations — pick_colors
text: character vector subset hex, matrix distances color_distance()

title: Heuristics for Color Distances and Locations — pick_colors

what: Crayon Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_crayons
title: Crayon Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_crayons
Crayon Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_crayons
code: scale_color_crayons(palette = "standard16", which = NULL, ..., reverse = FALSE)  scale_fill_crayons(palette = "standard16", which = NULL, ..., reverse = FALSE)  scale_colour_crayons(   palette = "standard16",   which = NULL,   ...,   reverse = FALSE )

title: Crayon Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_crayons
text: palette palette names(crayons) use numeric indices colors use. NULL default. ... arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale() reverse vector reversed? Default FALSE.

title: Crayon Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_crayons
Crayon Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_crayons
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot2::mpg |>   ggplot() +    geom_point(aes(displ, hwy, colour = class)) +    scale_color_crayons(palette = 'original')   ggplot2::mpg |>   ggplot() +    geom_point(aes(displ, hwy, fill = class), pch = 23, color = 'transparent') +    scale_fill_crayons(palette = 'original')

title: crayons 0.0.1
